TypeSignature.Value: public class MediaMetadataRetriever : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Lang.IAutoCloseable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MediaMetadataRetriever extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Lang.IAutoCloseable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: MediaMetadataRetriever class provides a unified interface for retrieving frame and meta data from an input media file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtIndex(int32 frameIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: 0-based index of the video frame. The frame index must be that of a valid frame. The total number of frames available for retrieval can be queried via the #METADATA_KEY_VIDEO_FRAME_COUNT key.
Docs.summary: This method is similar to #getFrameAtIndex(int, BitmapParams) except that the default for BitmapParams will be used.
Docs.returns: A Bitmap containing the requested video frame, or null if the retrieval fails.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: 0-based index of the video frame. The frame index must be that of a valid frame. The total number of frames available for retrieval can be queried via the #METADATA_KEY_VIDEO_FRAME_COUNT key.
Docs.summary: This method is similar to #getFrameAtIndex(int, BitmapParams) except that the default for BitmapParams will be used.
Docs.returns: A Bitmap containing the requested video frame, or null if the retrieval fails.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime(int64 timeUs) cil managed
abstract member GetFrameAtTime : int64 -> Android.Graphics.Bitmap override this.GetFrameAtTime : int64 -> Android.Graphics.Bitmap

Docs.param: The time position where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarentee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.
Docs.summary: Call this method after setDataSource().
Docs.returns: A Bitmap containing a representative video frame, which can be null, if such a frame cannot be retrieved.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime (long timeUs, Android.Media.Option option);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime(int64 timeUs, valuetype Android.Media.Option option) cil managed
abstract member GetFrameAtTime : int64 * Android.Media.Option -> Android.Graphics.Bitmap override this.GetFrameAtTime : int64 * Android.Media.Option -> Android.Graphics.Bitmap

Docs.param: The time position where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarantee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.

a hint on how the frame is found. Use if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp earlier than or the same as timeUs. Use if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp later than or the same as timeUs. Use if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp closest to or the same as timeUs. Use if one wants to retrieve a frame that may or may not be a sync frame but is closest to or the same as timeUs. often has larger performance overhead compared to the other options if there is no sync frame located at timeUs.
Docs.summary: Call this method after setDataSource().
Docs.returns: A Bitmap containing a representative video frame, which can be null, if such a frame cannot be retrieved.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Graphics.Bitmap> GetFramesAtIndex (int frameIndex, int numFrames);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Graphics.Bitmap> GetFramesAtIndex(int32 frameIndex, int32 numFrames) cil managed

Docs.param: 0-based index of the first video frame to retrieve. The frame index must be that of a valid frame. The total number of frames available for retrieval can be queried via the #METADATA_KEY_VIDEO_FRAME_COUNT key.
number of consecutive video frames to retrieve. Must be a positive value. The stream must contain at least numFrames frames starting at frameIndex.
Docs.summary: This method is similar to #getFramesAtIndex(int, int, BitmapParams) except that the default for BitmapParams will be used.
Docs.returns: An list of Bitmaps containing the requested video frames. The returned array could contain less frames than requested if the retrieval fails.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Graphics.Bitmap> GetFramesAtIndex (int frameIndex, int numFrames, Android.Media.MediaMetadataRetriever.BitmapParams params);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Graphics.Bitmap> GetFramesAtIndex(int32 frameIndex, int32 numFrames, class Android.Media.MediaMetadataRetriever/BitmapParams params) cil managed

Docs.param: 0-based index of the first video frame to retrieve. The frame index must be that of a valid frame. The total number of frames available for retrieval can be queried via the #METADATA_KEY_VIDEO_FRAME_COUNT key.
number of consecutive video frames to retrieve. Must be a positive value. The stream must contain at least numFrames frames starting at frameIndex.
Docs.summary: This method is similar to #getFramesAtIndex(int, int, BitmapParams) except that the default for BitmapParams will be used.
Docs.returns: An list of Bitmaps containing the requested video frames. The returned array could contain less frames than requested if the retrieval fails.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetScaledFrameAtTime (long timeUs, Android.Media.Option option, int dstWidth, int dstHeight);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetScaledFrameAtTime(int64 timeUs, valuetype Android.Media.Option option, int32 dstWidth, int32 dstHeight) cil managed

abstract member GetScaledFrameAtTime : int64 * Android.Media.Option * int * int -> Android.Graphics.Bitmap override this.GetScaledFrameAtTime : int64 * Android.Media.Option * int * int -> Android.Graphics.Bitmap

Docs.param: The time position in microseconds where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarantee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.

a hint on how the frame is found. Use #OPTION_PREVIOUS_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp earlier than or the same as timeUs. Use #OPTION_NEXT_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp later than or the same as timeUs. Use #OPTION_CLOSEST_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp closest to or the same as timeUs. Use #OPTION_CLOSEST if one wants to retrieve a frame that may or may not be a sync frame but is closest to or the same as timeUs. #OPTION_CLOSEST often has larger performance overhead compared to the other options if there is no sync frame located at timeUs.
Docs.summary: This method is similar to #getScaledFrameAtTime(long, int, int, int, BitmapParams) except that the device will choose the actual Bitmap.Config to use.
Docs.returns: A Bitmap containing a representative video frame, which can be null, if such a frame cannot be retrieved. Bitmap#getConfig() can be used to query the actual Bitmap.Config.

format.a: Java documentation for android.media.MediaMetadataRetriever.getScaledFrameAtTime(long, int, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetScaledFrameAtTime (long timeUs, Android.Media.Option option, int dstWidth, int dstHeight, Android.Media.MediaMetadataRetriever.BitmapParams params);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetScaledFrameAtTime(int64 timeUs, valuetype Android.Media.Option option, int32 dstWidth, int32 dstHeight, class Android.Media.MediaMetadataRetriever/BitmapParams params) cil managed

Docs.param: The time position in microseconds where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarantee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.

a hint on how the frame is found. Use #OPTION_PREVIOUS_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp earlier than or the same as timeUs. Use #OPTION_NEXT_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp later than or the same as timeUs. Use #OPTION_CLOSEST_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp closest to or the same as timeUs. Use #OPTION_CLOSEST if one wants to retrieve a frame that may or may not be a sync frame but is closest to or the same as timeUs. #OPTION_CLOSEST often has larger performance overhead compared to the other options if there is no sync frame located at timeUs.
Docs.summary: This method is similar to #getScaledFrameAtTime(long, int, int, int, BitmapParams) except that the device will choose the actual Bitmap.Config to use.
Docs.returns: A Bitmap containing a representative video frame, which can be null, if such a frame cannot be retrieved. Bitmap#getConfig() can be used to query the actual Bitmap.Config.

format.a: Java documentation for android.media.MediaMetadataRetriever.getScaledFrameAtTime(long, int, int, int).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.Option OptionClosest = (3)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.Option enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: This option is used with #getFrameAtTime(long, int) to retrieve a frame (not necessarily a key frame) associated with a data source that is located closest to or at the given time.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.Option OptionClosestSync = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.Option enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: This option is used with #getFrameAtTime(long, int) to retrieve a sync (or key) frame associated with a data source that is located closest to (in time) or at the given time.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.Option OptionNextSync = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.Option enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: This option is used with #getFrameAtTime(long, int) to retrieve a sync (or key) frame associated with a data source that is located right after or at the given time.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.Option OptionPreviousSync = (0)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.Option enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: This option is used with #getFrameAtTime(long, int) to retrieve a sync (or key) frame associated with a data source that is located right before or at the given time.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: This method is similar to #getPrimaryImage(BitmapParams) except that the default for BitmapParams will be used.
Docs.value: the primary image, or null if it cannot be retrieved.
